tests.title: Users MFA Enabled
tests.description: Ensures a multi-factor authentication device is enabled for all users within the account
tests.more_info: User accounts should have an MFA device setup to enable two-factor authentication
tests.recommended_action: Enable an MFA device for the user account

tests.title: Access Keys Rotated
tests.description: Ensures access keys are not older than 180 days in order to reduce accidental exposures
tests.more_info: Access keys should be rotated frequently to avoid having them accidentally exposed.
tests.recommended_action: To rotate an access key, first create a new key, replace the key and secret throughout your app or scripts, then set the previous key to disabled. Once you ensure that no services are broken, then fully delete the old key.

tests.title: Access Keys Last Used
tests.description: Detects access keys that have not been used for a period of time and that should be decommissioned
tests.more_info: Having numerous, unused access keys extends the attack surface. Access keys should be removed if they are no longer being used.
tests.recommended_action: Log into the IAM portal and remove the offending access key.

results.message: No users using access keys found

tests.title: Access Keys Extra
tests.description: Detects the use of more than one access key by any single user
tests.more_info: Having more than one access key for a single user increases the chance of accidental exposure. Each account should only have one key that defines the users permissions.
tests.recommended_action: Remove the extra access key for the specified user.

results.message: No users using access keys found

tests.title: RDS Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures RDS instances are not launched into the public cloud
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, RDS instances should not have a public endpoint and should be accessed from within a VPC only.
tests.recommended_action: Remove the public endpoint from the RDS instance

tests.title: CloudTrail Bucket Access Logging
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket has access logging enabled to detect tampering of log files
tests.more_info: CloudTrail buckets should utilize access logging for an additional layer of auditing. If the log files are deleted or modified in any way, the additional access logs can help determine who made the changes.
tests.recommended_action: Enable access logging on the CloudTrail bucket from the S3 console

tests.title: CloudTrail Bucket Private
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket is not publicly accessible
tests.more_info: CloudTrail buckets contain large amounts of sensitive account data and should only be accessible by logged in users.
tests.recommended_action: Set the S3 bucket access policy for all CloudTrail buckets to only allow known users to access its files.

tests.title: Public S3 CloudFront Origin
tests.description: Detects the use of an S3 bucket as a CloudFront origin without an origin access identity
tests.more_info: When S3 is used as an origin for a CloudFront bucket, the contents should be kept private and an origin access identity should allow CloudFront access. This prevents someone from bypassing the caching benefits that CloudFront provides, repeatedly loading objects directly from S3, and amassing a large access bill.
tests.recommended_action: Create an origin access identity for CloudFront, then make the contents of the S3 bucket private.

tests.title: Redshift Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures Redshift clusters are not launched into the public cloud
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, Redshift clusters should not have a public endpoint and should be accessed from within a VPC only.
tests.recommended_action: Remove the public endpoint from the Redshift cluster

tests.title: Open All Ports Protocols
tests.description: Determine if security group has all ports or protocols open to the public
tests.more_info: Security groups should be created on a per-service basis and avoid allowing all ports or protocols.
tests.recommended_action: Modify the security group to specify a specific port and protocol to allow.

tests.description: Ensures SQS policies disallow cross-account access
tests.more_info: SQS policies should be carefully restricted to prevent publishing or reading from the queue from unexpected sources. Queue policies can be used to limit these privileges.

tests.title: ECR Repository Policy
tests.description: Ensures ECR repository policies do not enable global or public access to images
tests.more_info: ECR repository policies should limit access to images to known IAM entities and AWS accounts and avoid the use of account-level wildcards.
tests.recommended_action: Update the repository policy to limit access to known IAM entities.

tests.title: Users Password And Keys
tests.description: Detects whether users with a console password are also using access keys
tests.more_info: Access keys should only be assigned to machine users and should not be used for accounts that have console password access.
tests.recommended_action: Remove access keys from all users with console access.

tests.title: Root Hardware MFA
tests.description: Ensures the root account is using a hardware MFA device
tests.more_info: The root account should use a hardware MFA device for added security, rather than a virtual device which could be more easily compromised.
tests.recommended_action: Enable a hardware MFA device for the root account and disable any virtual devices

tests.title: S3 Bucket Public Access Block
tests.description: Ensures S3 public access block is enabled on all buckets or for AWS account
tests.more_info: Blocking S3 public access at the account level or bucket-level ensures objects are not accidentally exposed.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the S3 public access block on all S3 buckets or for AWS account.

tests.title: CloudTrail Encryption
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail encryption at rest is enabled for logs
tests.more_info: CloudTrail log files contain sensitive information about an account and should be encrypted at rest for additional protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail log encryption through the CloudTrail console or API
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected Cloud trails will be enabled.

tests.title: Redshift Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures at-rest encryption is setup for Redshift clusters
tests.more_info: AWS provides at-read encryption for Redshift clusters which should be enabled to ensure the integrity of data stored within the cluster.
tests.recommended_action: Redshift does not currently allow modifications to encryption after the cluster has been launched, so a new cluster will need to be created with encryption enabled.

tests.title: Redshift Publicly Accessible
tests.description: Ensures Redshift clusters are not launched into the public cloud
tests.more_info: Unless there is a specific business requirement, Redshift clusters should not have a public endpoint and should be accessed from within a VPC only.
tests.recommended_action: Remove the public endpoint from the Redshift cluster

tests.title: Insecure CloudFront Protocols
tests.description: Detects the use of insecure HTTPS SSL/TLS protocols for use with HTTPS traffic between viewers and CloudFront
tests.more_info: CloudFront supports SSLv3 and TLSv1 protocols for use with HTTPS traffic, but only TLSv1.1 or higher should be used unless there is a valid business justification to support the older, insecure SSLv3.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that traffic sent between viewers and CloudFront is passed over HTTPS and uses TLSv1.1 or higher.

tests.title: Encrypted AMI
tests.description: Ensures EBS-backed AMIs are configured to use encryption
tests.more_info: AMIs with unencrypted data volumes can be used to launch unencrypted instances that place data at risk.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure all AMIs have encrypted EBS volumes.

tests.title: CloudFront HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures CloudFront distributions are configured to redirect non-HTTPS traffic to HTTPS.
tests.more_info: For maximum security, CloudFront distributions can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections or to redirect HTTP connections to HTTPS.
tests.recommended_action: Remove HTTP-only listeners from distributions.
tests.remediation_description: CloudFront distribution will be configured to only accept HTTPS connections or to redirect HTTP connections to HTTPS.

tests.title: ELB HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures ELBs are configured to only accept connections on HTTPS ports.
tests.more_info: For maximum security, ELBs can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections. Standard HTTP connections  will be blocked. This should only be done if the  client application is configured to query HTTPS  directly and not rely on a redirect from HTTP.
tests.recommended_action: Remove non-HTTPS listeners from load balancer.
tests.remediation_description: All HTTP Listeners will be deleted

tests.title: Open All Ports Protocols
tests.description: Determine if security group has all ports or protocols open to the public
tests.more_info: Security groups should be created on a per-service basis and avoid allowing all ports or protocols.
tests.recommended_action: Modify the security group to specify a specific port and protocol to allow.

tests.title: EFS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures that EFS volumes are encrypted at rest
tests.more_info: EFS offers data at rest encryption using keys managed through AWS Key Management Service (KMS).
tests.recommended_action: Encryption of data at rest can only be enabled during file system creation. Encryption of data in transit is configured when mounting your file system. 1. Backup your data in not encrypted efs 2. Recreate the EFS and select 'Enable encryption of data at rest'

tests.title: EC2 Instance Key Based Login
tests.description: Ensures EC2 instances have associated keys for password-less SSH login
tests.more_info: AWS allows EC2 instances to be launched with a specified PEM key for SSH login which should be used instead of user and password login.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure each EC2 instance has an associated SSH key and disable password login.

tests.title: Shield Advanced Enabled
tests.description: Ensures AWS Shield Advanced is setup and properly configured
tests.more_info: AWS Shield Advanced provides enhanced DDOS protection for all enrolled services within a subscribed account. Subscriptions should be active.
tests.recommended_action: Enable AWS Shield Advanced for the account.

tests.title: Shield Emergency Contacts
tests.description: Ensures AWS Shield emergency contacts are configured
tests.more_info: AWS Shield Emergency contacts should be configured so that AWS can contact an account representative in the event of a DDOS event.
tests.recommended_action: Configure emergency contacts within AWS Shield for the account.

tests.title: Shield Protections
tests.description: Ensures AWS Shield Advanced is configured to protect account resources
tests.more_info: Once AWS Shield Advanced is enabled, it can be applied to resources within the account including ELBs, CloudFront.
tests.recommended_action: Enable AWS Shield Advanced on resources within the account.

tests.title: RDS Snapshot Encryption
tests.description: Ensures encryption is enabled for RDS snapshots to ensure encryption of data at rest.
tests.more_info: AWS provides encryption for RDS snapshots which should be enabled to ensure that all data at rest is encrypted.
tests.recommended_action: Copy the snapshot to a new snapshot that is encrypted and delete the old snapshot.

tests.title: CloudFront WAF Enabled
tests.description: Ensures CloudFront distributions have WAF enabled.
tests.more_info: Enabling WAF allows control over requests to the Cloudfront Distribution, allowing or denying traffic based off rules in the Web ACL
tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the WAF service. 2. Enter Web ACLs and filter by global. 3. If no Web ACL is found, Create a new global Web ACL and in Resource type to associate with web ACL, select the Cloudfront Distribution.

tests.title: ELB WAF Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that all Application Load Balancers have WAF enabled.
tests.more_info: Enabling WAF allows control over requests to the load balancer, allowing or denying traffic based off rules in the Web ACL
tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the WAF service. 2. Enter Web ACLs and filter by the region the Application Load Balancer is in. 3. If no Web ACL is found, Create a new Web ACL in the region the ALB resides and in Resource type to associate with web ACL, select the Load Balancer.

tests.title: Users Password And Keys
tests.description: Detects whether users with a console password are also using access keys
tests.more_info: Access keys should only be assigned to machine users and should not be used for accounts that have console password access.
tests.recommended_action: Remove access keys from all users with console access.

tests.title: S3 Bucket Encryption
tests.description: Ensures object encryption is enabled on S3 buckets
tests.more_info: S3 object encryption provides fully-managed encryption of all objects uploaded to an S3 bucket.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CMK KMS-based encryption for all S3 buckets.
tests.remediation_description: The impacted bucket will be configured to use either AES-256 encryption, or CMK-based encryption if a KMS key ID is provided.

tests.title: ElasticSearch Node To Node Encryption
tests.description: Ensures ElasticSearch domain traffic is encrypted in transit between nodes
tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should use node-to-node encryption to ensure data in transit remains encrypted using TLS 1.2.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure node-to-node encryption is enabled for all ElasticSearch domains.
tests.remediation_description: ES domain will be configured to use node-to-node encryption.

tests.title: ElasticSearch HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures ElasticSearch domains are configured to enforce HTTPS connections
tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should be configured to enforce HTTPS connections for all clients to ensure encryption of data in transit.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure HTTPS connections are enforced for all ElasticSearch domains.
tests.remediation_description: ES domain will be configured to enforce HTTPS.

tests.title: Insecure EC2 Metadata Options
tests.description: Ensures EC2 instance metadata is updated to require HttpTokens or disable HttpEndpoint
tests.more_info: The new EC2 metadata service prevents SSRF attack escalations from accessing the sensitive instance metadata endpoints.
tests.recommended_action: Update instance metadata options to use IMDSv2

tests.title: GuardDuty is Enabled
tests.description: Ensures GuardDuty is enabled
tests.more_info: GuardDuty provides threat intelligence by analyzing several AWS data sources for security risks and should be enabled in all accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Enable GuardDuty for all AWS accounts.

tests.title: GuardDuty Master Account
tests.description: Ensures GuardDuty master account is correct
tests.more_info: Organizations with large numbers of AWS accounts should configure GuardDuty findings from all member accounts to be sent to a consistent master account.
tests.recommended_action: Configure the member account to send GuardDuty findings to a known master account.

tests.title: S3 Bucket Enforce Object Encryption
tests.description: Ensures S3 bucket policies do not allow uploads of unencrypted objects
tests.more_info: S3 bucket policies can be configured to block uploads of objects that are not encrypted.
tests.recommended_action: Set the S3 bucket policy to deny uploads of unencrypted objects.

tests.title: DMS Encryption Enabled
tests.description: Ensures DMS encryption is enabled using a CMK
tests.more_info: Data sent through the data migration service is encrypted using KMS. Encryption is enabled by default, but it is recommended to use customer managed keys.
tests.recommended_action: Enable encryption using KMS CMKs for all DMS replication instances.

tests.title: ELBv2 HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures ELBs are configured to only accept connections on HTTPS ports.
tests.more_info: For maximum security, ELBs can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections. Standard HTTP connections  will be blocked. This should only be done if the  client application is configured to query HTTPS  directly and not rely on a redirect from HTTP.
tests.recommended_action: Remove non-HTTPS listeners from load balancer.
tests.remediation_description: All HTTP Listeners will be deleted

tests.title: ELBv2 WAF Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that all Application Load Balancers have WAF enabled.
tests.more_info: Enabling WAF allows control over requests to the load balancer, allowing or denying traffic based off rules in the Web ACL
tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the WAF service. 2. Enter Web ACLs and filter by the region the Application Load Balancer is in. 3. If no Web ACL is found, Create a new Web ACL in the region the ALB resides and in Resource type to associate with web ACL, select the Load Balancer.

tests.title: Open Salt
tests.description: Determine if TCP ports 4505 or 4506 for the Salt master are open to the public
tests.more_info: Active Salt vulnerabilities, CVE-2020-11651 and CVE-2020-11652 are exploiting Salt instances exposed to the internet. These ports should be closed immediately.
tests.recommended_action: Restrict TCP ports 4505 and 4506 to known IP addresses
tests.remediation_description: The impacted security group rule will be deleted if no input is provided. Otherwise, any input will replace the open CIDR rule.

tests.title: SQL Server TLS Version
tests.description: Ensures RDS SQL Servers do not allow outdated TLS certificate versions
tests.more_info: TLS 1.2 or higher should be used for all TLS connections to RDS. A parameter group can be used to enforce this connection type.
tests.recommended_action: Create a parameter group that contains the TLS version restriction and limit access to TLS 1.2 or higher
tests.remediation_description: TLS 1.2 will be enabled, TLS 1.0 and TLS 1.1 will be disabled

tests.recommended_action: Enable volume encryption for the Comprehend job

tests.title: EMR Encryption In Transit
tests.description: Ensures encryption in transit is enabled for EMR clusters
tests.more_info: EMR clusters should be configured to enable encryption in transit.
tests.recommended_action: Update security configuration associated with EMR cluster to enable encryption in transit.

tests.title: EMR Encryption At Rest
tests.description: Ensures encryption at rest for local disks is enabled for EMR clusters
tests.more_info: EMR clusters should be configured to enable encryption at rest for local disks.
tests.recommended_action: Update security configuration associated with EMR cluster to enable encryption at rest for local disks.

tests.title: S3 Secure Transport Enabled
tests.description: Ensure AWS S3 buckets enforce SSL to secure data in transit
tests.more_info: S3 buckets should be configured to strictly require SSL connections to deny unencrypted HTTP requests when dealing with sensitive data.
tests.recommended_action: Update S3 bucket policy to enforse SSL to secure data in transit.

tests.title: SNS Topic CMK Encryption
tests.description: Ensures Amazon SNS topics are encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs).
tests.more_info: AWS SNS topics should be  encrypted with KMS Customer Master Keys (CMKs) instead of AWS managed-keysin order to have a more granular control over the SNS data-at-rest encryption and decryption process.
tests.recommended_action: Update SNS topics to use Customer Master Keys (CMKs) for Server-Side Encryption.

data.name: PR.PT-5
data.description: Mechanisms (e.g., failsafe, load balancing, hot swap) are implemented to achieve resilience requirements in normal and adverse situations.

tests.title: Domain Auto Renew
tests.description: Ensures domains are set to auto renew through Route53
tests.more_info: Domains purchased through Route53 should be set to auto renew. Domains that are not renewed can quickly be acquired by a third-party and cause loss of access for customers.
tests.recommended_action: Enable auto renew for the domain

tests.title: RDS Automated Backups
tests.description: Ensures automated backups are enabled for RDS instances
tests.more_info: AWS provides a simple method of backing up RDS instances at a regular interval. This should be enabled to provide an option for restoring data in the event of a database compromise or hardware failure.
tests.recommended_action: Enable automated backups for the RDS instance

tests.title: VPC Multiple Subnets
tests.description: Ensures that VPCs have multiple subnets to provide a layered architecture
tests.more_info: VPCs should be designed to have separate public and private subnets, ideally across availability zones, enabling a DMZ-style architecture.
tests.recommended_action: Create at least two subnets in each VPC, utilizing one for public traffic and the other for private traffic.

tests.title: ASG Multiple AZ
tests.description: Ensures that ASGs are created to be cross-AZ for high availability.
tests.more_info: ASGs can easily be configured to allow instances to launch in multiple availability zones. This ensures that the ASG can continue to scale, even when AWS is experiencing downtime in one or more zones.
tests.recommended_action: Modify the autoscaling instance to enable scaling across multiple availability zones.

tests.title: RDS Multiple AZ
tests.description: Ensures that RDS instances are created to be cross-AZ for high availability.
tests.more_info: Creating RDS instances in a single AZ creates a single point of failure for all systems relying on that database. All RDS instances should be created in multiple AZs to ensure proper failover.
tests.recommended_action: Modify the RDS instance to enable scaling across multiple availability zones.

tests.title: NAT Multiple AZ
tests.description: Ensures managed NAT instances exist in at least 2 AZs for availability purposes
tests.more_info: Creating NAT instances in a single AZ creates a single point of failure for all systems in the VPC. All managed NAT instances should be created in multiple AZs to ensure proper failover.
tests.recommended_action: Launch managed NAT instances in multiple AZs.

tests.title: Empty AutoScaling Group
tests.description: Ensures all autoscaling groups contain at least 1 instance.
tests.more_info: AutoScaling groups that are no longer in use should be deleted to prevent accidental use.
tests.recommended_action: Delete the unused AutoScaling group.

tests.title: Auto Scaling Notifications Active
tests.description: Ensures auto scaling groups have notifications active.
tests.more_info: Notifications can be sent to an SNS endpoint when scaling actions occur, which should be set to ensure all scaling activity is recorded.
tests.recommended_action: Add a notification endpoint to the auto scaling group.

tests.title: Auto Scaling Group Missing ELB
tests.description: Ensures all Auto Scaling groups are referencing active load balancers.
tests.more_info: Each Auto Scaling group with a load balancer configured should reference an active ELB.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that the Auto Scaling group load balancer has not been deleted. If so, remove it from the ASG.

tests.title: AutoScaling ELB Same Availability Zone
tests.description: Ensures all autoscaling groups with attached ELBs are operating in the same availability zone.
tests.more_info: To work properly and prevent orphaned instances, ELBs must be created in the same availability zones as the backend instances in the autoscaling group.
tests.recommended_action: Update the ELB to use the same availability zones as the autoscaling group.

tests.title: Suspended AutoScaling Groups
tests.description: Ensures that there are no Amazon AutoScaling groups with suspended processes.
tests.more_info: AutoScaling groups should not have any suspended processes to avoid disrupting the AutoScaling workflow.
tests.recommended_action: Update the AutoScaling group to resume the suspended processes.

data.name: DE.AE-1
data.description: A baseline of network operations and expected data flows for users and systems is established and managed.

tests.title: CloudTrail Bucket Delete Policy
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket has a policy to prevent deletion of logs without an MFA token
tests.more_info: To provide additional security, CloudTrail logging buckets should require an MFA token to delete objects
tests.recommended_action: Enable MFA delete on the CloudTrail bucket

tests.title: Root MFA Enabled
tests.description: Ensures a multi-factor authentication device is enabled for the root account
tests.more_info: The root account should have an MFA device setup to enable two-factor authentication.
tests.recommended_action: Enable an MFA device for the root account and then use an IAM user for managing services

results.message: An MFA device was not found for the root account

tests.title: Users MFA Enabled
tests.description: Ensures a multi-factor authentication device is enabled for all users within the account
tests.more_info: User accounts should have an MFA device setup to enable two-factor authentication
tests.recommended_action: Enable an MFA device for the user account

tests.title: S3 Bucket All Users Policy
tests.description: Ensures S3 bucket policies do not allow global write, delete, or read permissions
tests.more_info: S3 buckets can be configured to allow the global principal to access the bucket via the bucket policy. This policy should be restricted only to known users or accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Remove wildcard principals from the bucket policy statements.
tests.remediation_description: Bucket policy will be deleted for affected buckets.

tests.title: Insecure CloudFront Protocols
tests.description: Detects the use of insecure HTTPS SSL/TLS protocols for use with HTTPS traffic between viewers and CloudFront
tests.more_info: CloudFront supports SSLv3 and TLSv1 protocols for use with HTTPS traffic, but only TLSv1.1 or higher should be used unless there is a valid business justification to support the older, insecure SSLv3.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that traffic sent between viewers and CloudFront is passed over HTTPS and uses TLSv1.1 or higher.

tests.title: CloudFront HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures CloudFront distributions are configured to redirect non-HTTPS traffic to HTTPS.
tests.more_info: For maximum security, CloudFront distributions can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections or to redirect HTTP connections to HTTPS.
tests.recommended_action: Remove HTTP-only listeners from distributions.
tests.remediation_description: CloudFront distribution will be configured to only accept HTTPS connections or to redirect HTTP connections to HTTPS.

tests.title: ELB HTTPS Only
tests.description: Ensures ELBs are configured to only accept connections on HTTPS ports.
tests.more_info: For maximum security, ELBs can be configured to only accept HTTPS connections. Standard HTTP connections  will be blocked. This should only be done if the  client application is configured to query HTTPS  directly and not rely on a redirect from HTTP.
tests.recommended_action: Remove non-HTTPS listeners from load balancer.
tests.remediation_description: All HTTP Listeners will be deleted

tests.title: S3 Bucket All Users ACL
tests.description: Ensures S3 buckets do not allow global write, delete, or read ACL permissions
tests.more_info: S3 buckets can be configured to allow anyone, regardless of whether they are an AWS user or not, to write objects to a bucket or delete objects. This option should not be configured unless there is a strong business requirement.
tests.recommended_action: Disable global all users policies on all S3 buckets and ensure both the bucket ACL is configured with least privileges.
tests.remediation_description: Bucket ACL will be modified to be private to bucket owner.

tests.title: KMS Key Policy
tests.description: Validates the KMS key policy to ensure least-privilege access.
tests.more_info: KMS key policies should be designed to limit the number of users who can perform encrypt and decrypt operations. Each application should use its own key to avoid over exposure.
tests.recommended_action: Modify the KMS key policy to remove any wildcards and limit the number of users and roles that can perform encrypt and decrypt operations using the key.

tests.title: Shield Advanced Enabled
tests.description: Ensures AWS Shield Advanced is setup and properly configured
tests.more_info: AWS Shield Advanced provides enhanced DDOS protection for all enrolled services within a subscribed account. Subscriptions should be active.
tests.recommended_action: Enable AWS Shield Advanced for the account.

tests.title: Shield Emergency Contacts
tests.description: Ensures AWS Shield emergency contacts are configured
tests.more_info: AWS Shield Emergency contacts should be configured so that AWS can contact an account representative in the event of a DDOS event.
tests.recommended_action: Configure emergency contacts within AWS Shield for the account.

tests.title: Shield Protections
tests.description: Ensures AWS Shield Advanced is configured to protect account resources
tests.more_info: Once AWS Shield Advanced is enabled, it can be applied to resources within the account including ELBs, CloudFront.
tests.recommended_action: Enable AWS Shield Advanced on resources within the account.

tests.title: IAM Role Policies
tests.description: Ensures IAM role policies are properly scoped with specific permissions
tests.more_info: Policies attached to IAM roles should be scoped to least-privileged access and avoid the use of wildcards.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure that all IAM roles are scoped to specific services and API calls.

tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the WAF service. 2. Enter Web ACLs and filter by global. 3. If no Web ACL is found, Create a new global Web ACL and in Resource type to associate with web ACL, select the Cloudfront Distribution.

tests.title: ELB WAF Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that all Application Load Balancers have WAF enabled.

tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the WAF service. 2. Enter Web ACLs and filter by the region the Application Load Balancer is in. 3. If no Web ACL is found, Create a new Web ACL in the region the ALB resides and in Resource type to associate with web ACL, select the Load Balancer.

tests.title: Root Hardware MFA
tests.description: Ensures the root account is using a hardware MFA device
tests.more_info: The root account should use a hardware MFA device for added security, rather than a virtual device which could be more easily compromised.
tests.recommended_action: Enable a hardware MFA device for the root account and disable any virtual devices

tests.title: ElasticSearch Node To Node Encryption

tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should use node-to-node encryption to ensure data in transit remains encrypted using TLS 1.2.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure node-to-node encryption is enabled for all ElasticSearch domains.
tests.remediation_description: ES domain will be configured to use node-to-node encryption.

tests.title: ElasticSearch HTTPS Only

tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should be configured to enforce HTTPS connections for all clients to ensure encryption of data in transit.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure HTTPS connections are enforced for all ElasticSearch domains.
tests.remediation_description: ES domain will be configured to enforce HTTPS.

tests.more_info: Organizations with large numbers of AWS accounts should configure GuardDuty findings from all member accounts to be sent to a consistent master account.

tests.title: SQL Server TLS Version
tests.description: Ensures RDS SQL Servers do not allow outdated TLS certificate versions
tests.more_info: TLS 1.2 or higher should be used for all TLS connections to RDS. A parameter group can be used to enforce this connection type.

data.name: DE.DP-2
data.description: Detection activities comply with all applicable requirements.

tests.title: CloudTrail Bucket Delete Policy
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket has a policy to prevent deletion of logs without an MFA token
tests.more_info: To provide additional security, CloudTrail logging buckets should require an MFA token to delete objects
tests.recommended_action: Enable MFA delete on the CloudTrail bucket

tests.title: CloudTrail Bucket Access Logging
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket has access logging enabled to detect tampering of log files
tests.more_info: CloudTrail buckets should utilize access logging for an additional layer of auditing. If the log files are deleted or modified in any way, the additional access logs can help determine who made the changes.
tests.recommended_action: Enable access logging on the CloudTrail bucket from the S3 console

tests.title: CloudTrail Encryption
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail encryption at rest is enabled for logs
tests.more_info: CloudTrail log files contain sensitive information about an account and should be encrypted at rest for additional protection.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudTrail log encryption through the CloudTrail console or API
tests.remediation_description: Encryption for the affected Cloud trails will be enabled.

tests.title: CloudTrail Bucket Private
tests.description: Ensures CloudTrail logging bucket is not publicly accessible
tests.more_info: CloudTrail buckets contain large amounts of sensitive account data and should only be accessible by logged in users.
tests.recommended_action: Set the S3 bucket access policy for all CloudTrail buckets to only allow known users to access its files.

tests.title: VPC Flow Logs Enabled
tests.description: Ensures VPC flow logs are enabled for traffic logging
tests.more_info: VPC flow logs record all traffic flowing in to and out of a VPC. These logs are critical for auditing and review after security incidents.
tests.recommended_action: Enable VPC flow logs for each VPC

tests.title: ELB Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures load balancers have request logging enabled.
tests.more_info: Logging requests to ELB endpoints is a helpful way of detecting and investigating potential attacks, malicious activity, or misuse of backend resources.Logs can be sent to S3 and processed for further analysis.
tests.recommended_action: Enable ELB request logging

tests.title: CloudFront Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures CloudFront distributions have request logging enabled.
tests.more_info: Logging requests to CloudFront distributions is a helpful way of detecting and investigating potential attacks, malicious activity, or misuse of backend resources. Logs can be sent to S3 and processed for further analysis.
tests.recommended_action: Enable CloudFront request logging.

tests.title: S3 Bucket Logging
tests.description: Ensures S3 bucket logging is enabled for S3 buckets
tests.more_info: S3 bucket logging helps maintain an audit trail of                 access that can be used in the event of a security                 incident.
tests.recommended_action: Enable bucket logging for each S3 bucket.

tests.title: Transfer Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures AWS Transfer servers have CloudWatch logging enabled.
tests.more_info: AWS Transfer servers can log activity to CloudWatch if a proper IAM service role is provided. This role should be configured for all servers to ensure proper access logging.
tests.recommended_action: Provide a valid IAM service role for AWS Transfer servers.

tests.title: RDS Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures logging is configured for RDS instances
tests.more_info: Logging database level events enables teams to analyze events for the purpose diagnostics as well as audit tracking for compliance purposes.
tests.recommended_action: Modify the RDS instance to enable logging as required.

tests.title: EKS Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures all EKS cluster logs are being sent to CloudWatch
tests.more_info: EKS supports routing of cluster event and audit logs to CloudWatch, including control plane logs. All logs should be sent to CloudWatch for security analysis.
tests.recommended_action: Enable all EKS cluster logs to be sent to CloudWatch with proper log retention limits.
tests.remediation_description: EKS logging will be enabled for all supported services.

tests.title: ElasticSearch Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures ElasticSearch domains are configured to log data to CloudWatch
tests.more_info: ElasticSearch domains should be configured with logging enabled with logs sent to CloudWatch for analysis and long-term storage.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure logging is enabled and a CloudWatch log group is specified for each ElasticSearch domain.

tests.title: ELBv2 Logging Enabled
tests.description: Ensures load balancers have request logging enabled.
tests.more_info: Logging requests to ELB endpoints is a helpful way of detecting and investigating potential attacks, malicious activity, or misuse of backend resources.Logs can be sent to S3 and processed for further analysis.
tests.recommended_action: Enable ELB request logging

data.name: RS.MI-1
data.description: Incidents are contained.

tests.title: Shield Advanced Enabled
tests.description: Ensures AWS Shield Advanced is setup and properly configured
tests.more_info: AWS Shield Advanced provides enhanced DDOS protection for all enrolled services within a subscribed account. Subscriptions should be active.
tests.recommended_action: Enable AWS Shield Advanced for the account.

tests.title: Shield Emergency Contacts
tests.description: Ensures AWS Shield emergency contacts are configured
tests.more_info: AWS Shield Emergency contacts should be configured so that AWS can contact an account representative in the event of a DDOS event.
tests.recommended_action: Configure emergency contacts within AWS Shield for the account.

tests.title: Shield Protections
tests.description: Ensures AWS Shield Advanced is configured to protect account resources
tests.more_info: Once AWS Shield Advanced is enabled, it can be applied to resources within the account including ELBs, CloudFront.
tests.recommended_action: Enable AWS Shield Advanced on resources within the account.

tests.title: EKS Private Endpoint
tests.description: Ensures the private endpoint setting is enabled for EKS clusters
tests.more_info: EKS private endpoints can be used to route all traffic between the Kubernetes worker and control plane nodes over a private VPC endpoint rather than across the public internet.
tests.recommended_action: Enable the private endpoint setting for all EKS clusters.

tests.title: CloudFront WAF Enabled
tests.description: Ensures CloudFront distributions have WAF enabled.
tests.more_info: Enabling WAF allows control over requests to the Cloudfront Distribution, allowing or denying traffic based off rules in the Web ACL
tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the WAF service. 2. Enter Web ACLs and filter by global. 3. If no Web ACL is found, Create a new global Web ACL and in Resource type to associate with web ACL, select the Cloudfront Distribution.

tests.title: ELB WAF Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that all Application Load Balancers have WAF enabled.
tests.more_info: Enabling WAF allows control over requests to the load balancer, allowing or denying traffic based off rules in the Web ACL
tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the WAF service. 2. Enter Web ACLs and filter by the region the Application Load Balancer is in. 3. If no Web ACL is found, Create a new Web ACL in the region the ALB resides and in Resource type to associate with web ACL, select the Load Balancer.

tests.title: GuardDuty is Enabled
tests.description: Ensures GuardDuty is enabled
tests.more_info: GuardDuty provides threat intelligence by analyzing several AWS data sources for security risks and should be enabled in all accounts.
tests.recommended_action: Enable GuardDuty for all AWS accounts.

tests.title: GuardDuty Master Account
tests.description: Ensures GuardDuty master account is correct
tests.more_info: Organizations with large numbers of AWS accounts should configure GuardDuty findings from all member accounts to be sent to a consistent master account.
tests.recommended_action: Configure the member account to send GuardDuty findings to a known master account.

tests.title: ELBv2 WAF Enabled
tests.description: Ensure that all Application Load Balancers have WAF enabled.
tests.more_info: Enabling WAF allows control over requests to the load balancer, allowing or denying traffic based off rules in the Web ACL
tests.recommended_action: 1. Enter the WAF service. 2. Enter Web ACLs and filter by the region the Application Load Balancer is in. 3. If no Web ACL is found, Create a new Web ACL in the region the ALB resides and in Resource type to associate with web ACL, select the Load Balancer.

data.name: RC.RP-1
data.description: Recovery processes and procedures are executed and maintained to ensure restoration of systems or assets affected by cybersecurity incidents.

tests.title: RDS Restorable
tests.description: Ensures RDS instances can be restored to a recent point
tests.more_info: AWS will maintain a point to which the database can be restored. This point should not drift too far into the past, or else the risk of irrecoverable data loss may occur.
tests.recommended_action: Ensure the instance is running and configured properly. If the time drifts too far, consider opening a support ticket with AWS.

tests.title: RDS Automated Backups
tests.description: Ensures automated backups are enabled for RDS instances
tests.more_info: AWS provides a simple method of backing up RDS instances at a regular interval. This should be enabled to provide an option for restoring data in the event of a database compromise or hardware failure.
tests.recommended_action: Enable automated backups for the RDS instance
